data.title: Very good food in downtown Ft. Wayne
data.text:
We came here with the family, so we had to sit in back with the family seating, but that was ok,especially for the kids.
The food here was amazing! We all really enjoyed what we ate and it was a fun place to eat.
The service could be a little better, but I know that they were busy that night.
I would like to come back with just the wife and try it out at the bar.

data.title: Great Gathering Place
data.text: Had lunch two days in a row at this quaint pub smack  dab in downtow n Fort Wayne two blocks from the   Allen County Library.  Fish sandwich was good, grilled cheese, the potato bread was really thick but good.  The salad was also good.  OUr waitress was helpful and  friendly. . Enjoyed the Guiness.

data.title: Wonderful!
data.text:
Excellent food and atmosphere. Had wide selection of drinks. Seafood chowder was full of large pieces of shrimp and scallops and so good! Tried a bite of my co workers shepherds pie and it was out of this world. I had corned beef and cabbage and it was the best I ever had at a restaurant. 
Also had the bananoffee dessert and OMG! So good!! Wish I lived closer to ft Wayne so I could come back more often.

data.title: still the best
data.text: great pub and food downtown...I'm always impressed by the taste and wonder why I didn't come here more often when I lived downtown.  they do pub food right and I like the few unique irish items on the menu.  atmosphere is also great.  great energy and comfortable

data.title: Effective
data.text: Awesome Irish pub, friendly staff , great pub atmosphere! First time here so wasn't sure what to expect, but it was what I was looking for! If I come back next year I would stop here again!!!

data.title: Great place.
data.text: We were working in the Genealogy Room at the Allen County Public Library and needed lunch. The pub was just a few blocks away and we decided to try it. The staff was very friendly and the food was really tasty.

data.title: Not overly impressed
data.text: I visited this Irish themed bar restaurant for lunch. They have nice outdoor seating areas, and on a nice day that's a great perk. However, my food was just fair. I had the grilled chicken sandwich and the chicken was over-cooked and tough. Service was fair. There's a sign asking patrons to "Wait to be seated," and they don't have a greeter handling that task. I had to flag down a server to get a table.

data.title: Pleasant and Comfortable
data.text: Dinner after a long day of moving, the romantic idea of an Irish pub seemed the right choice. Service was friendly, beer was good. Say outside because the inside was stuffy and warm, but have to you flavor of what you hope for. Started with the Buffaflower appetizer, tasty, but more of a salad than an appetizer, the calories was steamed and soaked in a Buffalo sauce and served on a bed of brands with a variety of small tomorrow's. Had fish and chips, of course,  great coleslaw, fish was delicious, and felt a little gypped on the chips small portion. One of us had the Irish cheddar sandwich, a really excellent grill cheese. And a generous house salad, also, fresh and tasty.  Great selection of beers on tap as well as bottles. No real wow, but a solid good experience.

data.title: Good Food, Beer and Friendly Service
data.text: We went here Saturday night with the soccer team. Since we were all from out of town for a tournament we needed a place that could accommodate us and our kids.  They had a side room for us. We had the nachos and pretzel bites which were really good. The nachos consisted of pulled pork, cheese and the rest of the nacho toppings on top of their chips. They had a good list of beers. The unfortunate thing was that I left my sweatshirt there and didn't realize it until it closed. They are closed on Sunday's so I was out of luck. However I found them on FB and sent a message regarding my situation and that we had to leave on Sunday. The manager, I think, offered to meet me at 3:00 so that I could get my sweatshirt back. I was very grateful for her doing that for me especially on her day off.  Sometimes Its the little things that will make me come back if we are in Ft. Wayne Indiana again. Thank you again guys for helping me out!!

data.title: Really fun place
data.text: Excellent lamb meatballs, I really enjoyed them.  Decent selection of beers and whiskey.  Fun atmosphere and good friendly service.

data.title: Always a good experienxe
data.text: I've been to JK's many times and always have a good experience. Good food (though not a good option for something light), great beer selection, reasonable prices, always fast and competent service. Highly recommend! Good for couples or groups.

data.title: Lovely Irish pub
data.text: If you're ever downtown and in the mood for an Irish experience, I recommend JK O'Donnell's. Excellent food and good drinks lots of fun with friends. Laid back atmosphere.

data.title: Great pub
data.text: Great selection of craft beers and phenomenal fish & chips. Laid back atmosphere is ideal for business drinks or just hanging out with friends. Bar staff are friendly and attentive.

data.title: Went for supper and was not impressed
data.text:
My wife and i walked there for supper last night 
We sat down at a table across from the bar and waited to order
My wife ordered a cup of potato soup with leeks and i had the full order of fish and chips
For the $28.00 spent i was disappointed to say the least
My wife's potato soup was brownish and had what look like hair in it (she did not eat more than 5 bites and wanted no more
My full order of fish and chips consisted of 3 cubes of fish and a hand full of fries the fish cubes were about 3 or 4 inches square 
Very very disappointed with the food not to mention the  loud mouth drinkers at the bar
Making it impossible to cary on a quiet conversation
Most likely will never return here

data.title: Great Irish bar!
data.text: One of Fort Wayne's best Irish bars.  Beautiful inside and the drinks are great.  Food is awesome also.

data.title: Saturday breakfast
data.text: You have to try out the Irish breakfast - its only served Saturdays from 11 to 2 pm.  Staff are friendly and you can take a nice walk around the downtown area before or after.

data.title: Just okay for the food
data.text: We have made a couple of trips to Ireland and were excited when we heard about this place on a recent trip to Fort Wayne.  After talking to locals and also reading the reviews it was clear that some people love it and some people, not so much.  We thought we would give it a shot and I was quite excited for the Shepherds Pie and my wife for the Stew.  Both of them were just okay.  Certainly not terrible but also certainly not great.  After eating we were both wondering when the food was actually cooked because it seemed like it was just warmed up and brought out to us.

data.title: Dinner for 3, Beer(s) were good food was average.
data.text: The service was good and the variety of beers offered was very good. They do not have a vast selection of "top shelf" beverages.  The food was just so-so.  There was little flavor, bland, and the fries were overcooked.  It had a loud pub feel which is not bad, but it did make a quiet conversation difficult.

data.title: Great family outing
data.text: Recently went here for a family outing—reserved for 30 people. Service was great, food very good and the beer wonderful. I was thoroughly pleased. Appetizers we tried included Lamb Pastry, Cheddar Fondue and Irish Whiskey Wings—we really liked the pastry and fondue, the wings not so much. I tried the Shepard’s Pie, other family members had Corn Beef N’ Cabbage, Bangers and Mash—all were very good. Finally, I can’t say enough about the server—she was great!

data.title: Not Impressed
data.text: I am a vegetarian, so I ordered the Garden Burger.  My waitress told me they had recently changed their vegetarian burger to a home-made one, which was different than what was listed on the menu.  Okay, no problem.  However, she didn't tell me that this new burger was $5 more expensive than the one on the menu, so I felt blindsided when the check came.  Besides that, the burger itself was gross and covered in spicy guacamole (at an Irish pub...) and the chips that came with it were burnt to a crisp.  I was surprised that whoever was working in the kitchen even put the chips on the plate.  The waitress didn't even ask for feedback about the food.  Just dropped off the check.  Rather than feeling like a valued customer, I left feeling unimpressed (and hungry).
